It looks really good.  I'd like to play w/ it.  Can you first give me 
feedback on the below?

+ "Error: Invalid Crawler Supplied" whenever I tried 'creating test set' 
(Selected 'heritrix', then filled out next screen variously -- if I left 
it empty or filled in a bunch of text it still gave me the error 
message).  This stops me being able to use the tool (Yesterday it seemed 
to work -- it at least generated a seed url for me).
+ Title is also misspelled on home page.
+ I added a crawler.  Its named heritrix too but had a different 
version.  In drop down it only shows the crawler name, not version, so 
its hard for me to distingush between the two.
+ I see on disk and in your commit of last night that tests on the 
filesystem are named 'test1', 'test3' etc.  Do they have to be named 
so?  Could they have more meaningful names so the 'background image 
extraction' test (test1) was  contained in a directory named 
'bkgrd_image_extraction' or some such.
+ Whats 'webroot' in the 'Add Test' page?

Thanks Parker,
St.Ack


Parker Thompson wrote:

>Hello,
>
>I'm (I think) ready to get that crawler testing stuff into CVS.  I wanted 
>to send out that link I promised (long ago) to the existing version, and 
>ask you to look it over:
>
>  http://parkert.com/crawlertest/
>
>I still haven't got the htaccess tests implemented, but didn't want this
>to stall any longer, and everything else should (in theory) be fine.  But 
>I suspect if you bang on this there's still a bug or two to be found.
>
>Thanks,
>
>pt.
>
